li.p:
(a)
The Small Business Act is the authority under which the Small Business Administration (SBA) and agencies consult and cooperate with each other in formulating policies to ensure that small business interests will be recognized and protected.

(b)
The Director of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization serves as the agency focal point for interfacing with SBA.
